page.title: 07CATON ST.PAUL'S C.E. CHURCH
page.content: The main church in the area is the Parish church of Caton St.Paul's,which stands in Brookhouse at the top of the village. A church existed here as early as the reign of Henry III 1216-1272. The church was rebuilt or extended in 1537. In the 19th century it was in such a state of disrepair it had to be taken down (all except the tower) and rebuilt at a cost of 3000 pounds. The new church was consecrated and given the name of Caton St. Paul's in 1865. An old doorway with a Norman arch,a relic of the 12th century building,has been built into the West wall of the church near the tower.The current vicar is the Reverend J.Tate. Until 1969 St.Paul's had a "daughter" church in Littledale,St.Mary's.This chapel doubled as a school when the children couldn't reach St. Paul's in wintry weather.
